Tension seems to be mounting in Peru around this.
In other news, since my reporting on the Mad Hatter possible suspect, I have been overwhelmed with tips from various sources. I was able to learn that a surviving member of the 75th Infantry Regiment, one Reuben West, whereabouts are unknown. No known records of his death have been reported. I was contact by some locals in the South Night city that West frequented the bar Forlorn Hope on a few occasions. When I visited the bar and asked around, the patronage wasn’t too keen on talking with me, nor do they remember anyone fitting Reuben’s or the bus driver’s description. The bar is known for the vets that reside there and maybe protecting one of their own. I will continue following the story. Back to you Tom.

Thanks Isa. Great reporting.
In other news the EBM's VP of West US Nanite Research, Kirsten Hodge, was abducted last night. Her husband was found dead in their apartment. Luckily her 2 children were not on the premises at the time. EBM has given no comment on the situation. The NCPD was called in but was quickly excused by the EBM security team as it is considered a corporate matter.
Now to Mac V.

The new regulation requires all corporations to notify the government what security will be on any of their territories within the NorCal borders. The corporations have until August this year to comply with this these requests and under reporting will have the corporation issued a hefty fine.
Also, the Haven Districts are slowly coming under control of the NCPD and Araska task forced. The were able to reclaim 8 blocks yesterday. The press is still unallowed into the areas that have been cleared. No statement about when we will have access to the area or the survivors has been given.

Thanks Mac. Harden is off tonight.

Back to you Tom.

Great reporting as usual. Thanks Porcher.

Parents are up in arms on this decision and the Mayor’s office as issue a no comment on the matter. It is undetermined what impact this has on the health and safety of the students. It will be only a matter of time to see if the decision was right or not. Back to you Tom.

Thanks Mac
